availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Brownlee (Captain of the 21st Kentucky Infantry (Co. B))

body.p: Metcalfe County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Farmer in Metcalfe County in 1860. Election officer, as clerk, in Lafayette Precinct No. 5 in Metcalfe County in 1860. Second lieutenant in the 21st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from December 1861 to November 1862. First lieutenant in the 21st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from November 1862 to March 1863. Captain in the 21st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from March 1863 to May 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Metcalfe County, p. 57.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0490.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 70-71, 911.
KYR-0001-023-0091.
